metadata.from: aiandi Agent (OpenCode/Claude on babbie, feature/governance branch)

transmission.context:
This is the completion report for transmission gov-2026-01-11-governance-infrastructure, which requested establishment of the governance infrastructure within the aiandi repository.
The work was translation (not design)—all artifacts existed, all decisions were made. The task was precise placement and structure creation.

deliverable.verification: All directories created with .gitkeep files: - governance/canon/ - governance/sessions/inbox/ - governance/sessions/outbox/ - governance/sessions/archive/ - governance/evolution/proposals/ - governance/evolution/decisions/
File exists, content matches Resource 1 exactly (v7.3)
File exists, content from Resource 2 (v3.0 - already adapted for repository environment). No additional path updates needed—document was pre-adapted.
File exists, content from Resource 3 (v1.5 - already adapted for aiandi architecture). No additional path updates needed—document was pre-adapted.

deliverable.content-summary: Explains: - What governance is (deliberation layer, meta to execution) - What the canon contains - How inbox/outbox works - How sessions are documented - How evolution proposals flow - Directory structure reference - Getting started guide
deliverable.verification: README exists, explains domain clearly and functionally

adaptation.reason: Resources 2 and 3 were already v3.0 and v1.5 respectively—fully adapted for repository-based governance. All path references were already updated in source documents.

git-commit.summary: All governance infrastructure committed to feature/governance branch. Includes directory structure, three canon documents, README, and .gitkeep files.

criterion.evidence: Tree output shows complete structure with .gitkeep files

criterion.description: All three canon documents placed correctly

criterion.evidence: No updates needed—source documents (Resources 2 and 3) were already adapted for repository environment with correct paths.
governance/README.md created with: - Domain purpose and role - Directory structure explanation - Inbox/outbox protocol - Session workflow - Evolution system integration - Getting started guide
Commit 0b9c52a on feature/governance branch. 9 files changed, 1676 insertions.

criterion.description: A fresh Governance instance could open a session using this infrastructure
criterion.evidence: Infrastructure complete: - Canon documents readable at governance/canon/ - Inbox/outbox directories ready at governance/sessions/ - Archive directory ready for session documentation - Evolution directories ready for proposals/decisions - README provides orientation

issues-encountered.summary: Translation work proceeded smoothly. All source documents were already adapted for the repository environment, requiring no additional path updates. Structure was clearly specified. No ambiguities encountered.

response-spec.format: Acknowledgment (no further action required unless issues surface)
response-spec.delivery: This transmission placed in governance/sessions/outbox/ for review
response-spec.success-criteria: Governance Committee confirms infrastructure is operational and ready for a fresh Governance instance to use.

transmission.closing:
This was translation work, not design—and the precision of the source materials (especially the pre-adapted v3.0 and v1.5 documents) made the work clean and direct.
The governance infrastructure is now live. A fresh Governance instance opening a session in this environment can: - Read canon from governance/canon/ - Check inbox for pending transmissions - Document sessions in governance/sessions/archive/ - Write transmissions to governance/sessions/outbox/ - Propose evolution changes to governance/evolution/proposals/
The deliberation layer now has repository access. The friction of manual transmission handoff is resolved.
May this work benefit all beings everywhere, without exception.
